Если Portal был игрой, которая открыла новый поджанр в жанре головоломок, то Portal 2 имеет всё то же самое, только больше и в обличии современного блокбастера.
Одиночная игра является продолжением первой части и проходится на одном дыхании. Вдобавок к синглплееру, игра предлагает кооператив, в котором вы должны работать в паре с партнёром. Совместная игра является отдельной историей с кучей фана и моря головоломок

A hilarious first-person puzzle-platformer, this game exceeds with charm and playability.
It is the sequel to the critically acclaimed Portal.

Survive the challenges the Tyrant GLaDOS has prepared for you and make it out of the test chambers alive!
Able to play local-coop, making the game even more fun!

Hra sa predvádza zaujímavým príbehom, a v celku dosť ťažkým singleplayerom.
Hra má dva príbehy: 1. Singleplayer
                                  2. Coop-mód

V cooperatívnom móde si Vy a Váš priateľ vyberete postavy (na výber sú len dve) a prechádzate levely od najľahšieho po najťahší. Každý level obsahuje kúsok príbehu. Postupne ich prechádzate a príbeh bude dávať čoraz viacej zmysel. Pri tejto hre je povinné používať aj kúsok brainu ;)

+Dva príbehy
+Pekné spracovanie okolia
+Logická hra
+Dosť dlhý coop
+Blbnutie v coope (kameň, papier, nožnice|tancovanie|Kradnutie "hláv")

-Len dve postavy

Portal 2 вообще крутая игруля очень нравится думать как проходить уровни эти все загадки головоломки ухх нервижки так и играют , особенно хочу отметить это хороший кооператив играть с другом очень прикольно и весело советую всем покупать эту игру и канечно же тем кому безумно понравилась 1 часть Portal 10/10

Seriously, where do I start with this game? Well...to put it simply, IT'S F-ING AMAZING!!!! 

If you like the original, buy it. 

If you like GREAT stories, buy it. 

If you want a good co-op game to spend days and days playing with a friend, buy it. 

It's a great sequel and continues the story from the first game. The story is really well done, it has it's highs, it's lows, it's funny parts and its sad parts. It's really well written, and it's one of my favourite stories in a game, of all time. Also it's pretty lengthy, I spent about 23 hours doing the story alone. 

Ontop of the amazing single player campaign, there is also a co-op campaign in which you and your friend (or a random stranger if you can't find a friend) can spend hours completing. It's not as long as the single player campaign, but it's good for about 5-6 hours...maybe. 

Then there are loads of amazing fan made maps. They are some amazing ones that are single player and some that are co-op, and these add hundreds and hundreds of hours ontop of this amazing game. 

To put it simply, if you don't own this game - you're missing out.

Oh...and I almost forgot to mention the content creator. It's great for creating basic single player and/or co-operative test chambers that are half decent. There are some (test chambers) that have clearly been made using better editing software, but the content creator is great for you to express your creative vision with the world.

“When you get money on Steam, don’t make more profit. Make Steam take the money back! Get mad! I don’t want your damn bucks, what the hell am I supposed to do with these? Demand to see Steam's manager! Make life rue the day it thought it could give Cave Johnson dollars! Buy Portal 2! Do you know who I am? I’m the man who’s gonna burn your house down! With dollar bills! I’m gonna get my engineers to invent combustible dollar bills that burns your house down!"
-Cave Johnson

I was really unsure how Valve would follow up the amazing first entry in the series. Especially since I heard they increased the length of the game considerately. I loved the length of the first one and finished the game in one 2-3 hour session. Fortunately, all my worries were unfounded.

The game starts pretty much like you expect it. You do some puzzles, race towards GlaDOS, and even have a funny side kick (great voice acting by Stephen Merchant). After the first couple of chapters however, the game and story completely pull the rug from under you. Like the first Portal, the story and characters are a highlight in this game.

The best part of this game is it's pacing. It never bores, never makes you do the same kind of puzzles for too long, and throws some new mechanics at you every hour.

Concluding, an amazing follow-up to an already amazing game! And I haven't even played the co-op campaign yet!

首先我要说，《传送门2》是我十多年的游戏生涯中唯一（[spoiler]其实并不止←_←[/spoiler]）看到结局时哭出来的作品。

     “无论我们这个世界多么可怕，它仍是美丽的”

    记得那我还是个高中小崽子的时候，当时的我还不知道什么是Steam，谁是G胖，只知道当时有一个叫做阀门的公司做了个风靡全世界的游戏叫做求生之路。班里兄弟几个每天逃课去网吧杀杀僵尸砍砍队友真是欢乐无比。而在每次通完那些和大家不知已经打了多少遍的关卡之后，闲不住的我总会在破网吧那不超过三行的游戏列表中寻找些新的东西。

    有一天，我看到了《Portal2》。
    ↓
    当时看到这个名字我完全不知道这游戏是讲什么的，但由于笔者本身是个科幻宅再加上觉得这个游戏都出第二部了想必是个大作，就抱着试一试的心态点了进去......然后我就看到了那个熟悉的脑袋上插着一个阀门的家伙。“原来这游戏也是阀门公司出的啊，一定不错”我怀着这样的想法开始了游戏的第一幕。
    
    然后这个Portal2就用了将近24个小时的时间一步一步向我证明了它的伟大。

    （如果没玩过的读者我建议你现在就去买一个把它打通关再继续向下阅读。）
    本游戏的基础世界观和美术风格在这里我不想赘述，但作为一个艺术工作者我只想谈谈它通过种种细节传递出的思想给予我心灵上的震撼。
    传送门2的通篇单人剧情里算上玩家自己看不到的主角才只有寥寥三个角色，其他两个还都是自主机器，而我们的主角却从未开口说过哪怕一句话；室内关卡周遭环境如后启示录电影般残破无比，但又能在GlaDOS的力量下一瞬间生成一个有又一个的封闭“测试”房间，气氛转换极快；虽说是V社拿手的fps游戏，但本作全篇却没有一滴血腥特效，取而代之的是房间里那干净的让你发怵的色彩基调。制作组这样的设计恰如其分地让玩家感受到了人类脱离文明与体制后的寂寥和对所谓“更高力量”出于本能的恐惧。但身边Wheatley的懦弱谦卑和内心实际的自恋暴虐，以及GlaDOS贯穿全篇的平淡却不失性感的嘲讽语调，这些却又让我们从这些所谓冷冰冰的人造机器身上感到了人性的光辉与温暖。尤其结局之后GlaDOS的那曲“Want You Gone”和“小天使”炮台们合奏的“Cara Mia Addio”以及最后镜头中光圈科技的后门居然是一片一望无际的麦田这些创意点把通关整作玩家的情感起伏直接带向高潮，生命的伟大与永恒瞬间在你面前展露无遗，笔者的眼泪当时就流了下来。这一切的细节与安排其实都在表达一件事，也是我个人理解制作人通过本座想表达的主旨：
    “保持坚强，坚持自我，你要相信：无论我们这个世界多么可怕，它仍是美丽的。”

    也许是我过于敏感，但我真心的希望玩这部作品的你能获得跟我一样的感动。
    
    感谢传送门2让我获得了这么美好的游戏体验，美丽的世界，伟大的游戏。


ps：GlaDOS在传送门第一部结尾唱的的“Still Ailve”也非常好听，有的人甚至认为是传送门系列最好听的歌曲，推荐

Great game.  I'll admit, it fried my brain in a few places and had me going "THIS IS IMPOSSIBLE! I TRIED EVERYTHING!"  A few times, I just wanted the game to be over.  

But the conclusion is epic, the game had me laughing more times than I could count, and it was overall a great gaming experience.  I would rate the single player campaign an 8.5/10. My main gripe is that there's about 2-3 hours of just walking through the game (in-between tests) that doesn't offer much action.  Trying to find the right spot to put a portal only to get to a balcony (for rooms and rooms on end) didn't add much to the game other than to add length.  Although the factory is quite a sight to behold, these dull hours left me frustrated.  This is the only thing keeping this game from being a 10/10.

Portal 2 has made players excited and happy for a few reasons. Portal 2 provides a longer story, game, and backstory. It's Added Co-op mode makes players work together while both solving the test at the same time. Many players also love that the developers have added in many jokes (some saying Chell is fat) along with the story like, Cave johnson slowly revealing that he IS somewhat insane and GLaDOS was once human and was Cave's wife. The new characters put into the game makes it more fun and interesting because you assist them and fight against them while keeping yourself alive from what you have learned. The introduction of Gels puts a new aspect to the game and shows you compleatly new gameplay!

There is so much to do in this game and the story line is very well written. I would recommend this game to anyone who is just bored and has a lot of time to kill. This game works your brain and will get you thinking in no time! After completeing the single player challenges you are able to play test worlds made by the community and the game evn has a builder/editor where you can create your own game maps for others to play. I would rate this game a 10/10.

You'll meet new characters and solve more puzzles but let's be honest the best thing about this game is the plot and cinematics that go along with the puzzles.  Worth every penny. Well, this was quite a drastic change from the first Portal. Not in a bad way like Hitman: Absolution (which i reviewed in a bit too much of detail). This could be one of the best sequels for a game, I've played, though it really didn't start as a serious project and since bloomed into something that's pretty damn great. 

If you're not familiar, this was really just a lone physics game that valve aquired and then turned into Portal. So where to go from a shot game about puzzles with physics? Start with: new puzzles (obviously), also make a well made story with atmosphere and humor the game was originally known for, include a mysterious deeper lore for previous fans, add new ways to solve puzzles, have friends co-op on a seperate part of the game with even more puzzles, then finaly as Cave Johnson would probably add "Market the crap out of it".
    
 So i am here to say they did it all, and they did it right. It's hard for me to say anything bad, not even sure there is anything inherently bad about this game. Maybe how mainsteam the game has become? Not really. Lack of puzzels after game? No they fixed that. Maybe the lack of answers from the lore? Hopefully in time it will all be answered. But overall in gameplay, visuals, and story, this one is a keeper.
